card.name: Aardvark
card.text: Runner cannot use worms during runs on this fort. If Runner uses a worm during a run on this fort before Aardvark is rezzed, you may rez Aardvark to trash that worm, and any bits spent using that worm on the current piece of ice are lost to no affect. Runners may use further icebreakers to break the ice.

card.name: Access through Alpha
card.text: (1): Base link 9. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
card.quote: "Wilderspace is made up of those areas of the Net that have not already been catalogued into one region or another." - Spider Murphy

card.name: Access to Arasaka
card.text: (2): Base link 4. (2): +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

card.name: Access to Kiribati
card.text: (1): Base link 1. (1): +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
card.quote: Third-World security and First-World bureaucracy - together at last.

card.name: Accounts Receivable
card.text: Gain (9).
card.quote: "But... but the equipment's already been installed in our employees."

card.name: ACME Savings and Loan
card.text: Rezzing ACME S&L costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. When you rez ACME S&L, gain (12) and trash ACME S&L. For the remainder of the game, pay (1) at the end of each of your turns or lose the game. You can remove this effect and score 1 agenda point by taking an action to pay (12).

card.name: Afreet
card.text: Afreet can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in Afreet have their strength reduced by 1. If Afreet leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.

card.name: AI Boon
card.text: (1): Break sentry subroutine. (1): +1 strength. At the start of each run, roll a die to determine AI Boon's strength * for that run.
card.quote: "Everything was going great until a Viral 18 wiped the instruction manual."

card.name: AI Chief Financial Officer
card.text: (A): Shuffle cards stored in HQ and the Archives into R&D; then draw five cards.
card.quote: "I think it's 'preferred' stock because their AI financial adviser prefers not to risk changing the board of directors!"

card.name: All-Nighter
card.text: Make a run; whether or not that run is successful, you may then make another run.
card.quote: "Of course, you start to hallucinate if you string too many of these together."

card.name: Annual Reviews
card.text: Draw three cards.
card.quote: "Just between you and me, his wouldn't be a bad time to impress the boss with your initiative."

card.name: Anonymous Tip
card.text: Derez a piece of black ice of your choice.
card.quote: "Netwatch doesn't take hints about corporate infractions. If you really want them to apply some heat to a patch of black ice, get a Hellhound to follow your link back to their offices."

card.name: Antiquated Interface Routines
card.text: All ice on this fort has +1 strength.

card.name: Arasaka Owns You
card.text: Do not play Arasaka Owns you as a normal action; instead, play it when you would suffer enough damage to flatline you. Prevent all of that damage, trash Arasaka Owns you, remove any brain damage you have suffered, and then refresh your hand to the minimum size. Gain (10) and remove all tags, at no cost. You forgo your next four actions, and you forfeit the next 3 agenda points you score.

card.name: Arasaka Portable Prototype
card.text: Provides +3 MU. Installing Arasaka Portable Prototype costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. Put (3) from the bank on Arasaka Portable Prototype when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Armadillo Armored Road Home
card.text: Put (2) from the bank on Armored Road Home when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. (T): Prevent up to 3 meat damage.

card.name: Armored Fridge
card.text: Put seven Ablative counters on Armored Fridge when it is installed. When the last Ablative counter has been removed, trash Armored Fridge. Ablative counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
card.quote: "I also once shut off the hot water line to my dishwasher and hid in there while it was running, but I'll never do that again" - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: Artemis 2020
card.text: Provides +2 MU. Put (2) from the bank on Artemis 2020 when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Artificial Security Directors
card.text: Difficulty of Black Ops agendas is reduced by 1.
card.quote: "We noticed a while ado that security directors developing cyberpsychosis - becoming less and less human - increased the effectiveness of our Black Ops dramatically. Unfortunately, they quickly became too unstable to be useful. This new program should solve all these problems, and more." - Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

card.name: Asp
card.text: (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay (1).
card.quote: Oh how sharper than a serpent's tooth is one of these suckers clamped onto the boot sector of a drive!

card.name: Audit of Call Records
card.text: Play only if Runner attempted two or more runs during his or her last turn. Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

card.name: Aujourd'Oui
card.text: (A): Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any program cards among them into your hand. Pay (1) for each card taken this way and show those cards to the corp. Shuffle your deck.

card.name: Back Door to Hilliard
card.text: (0): Base link 2. (3): +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
card.quote: Hilliard Registrar query confirmed for ICE UNIT CERBERUS BD62663-R. "Sorry, Mr. Cerberus, that class is full, though if you obtain authorization from your proctor, you may petition for entrance."

card.name: Back Door to Orbital Air
card.text: (1): Base link 2. (2): +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
card.quote: If you think the airlines are good at losing luggage, you should see what they can do with a trace attempt.

card.name: Baedeker's Net Map
card.text: (0): Base link 1 (1): +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.
card.quote: "I knew I should have taken the left region from Albuquerque!"

card.name: Bakdoor
card.text: (0): Base link 3 (2): +1 link. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

card.name: Ball and Chain
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay (2) when encountering a piece of ice, in addition to any other costs, or end the run.
card.difficulty: The payment of 2* must be perfor

card.name: Banpei
card.text: (s) Trash a program. (s) End the run.
card.quote: The survival of Bushido into cyberspace has spiritual significance to many execs.

card.name: Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker
card.text: (1): Break ice subroutine. (1): +1 strength. After passing each piece of ice, roll a die if you used Bartmoss Memorial Icebreaker to break any subroutines of that ice. On a 1, trash Memorial Icebreaker.

card.name: BBS Whispering Campaign
card.text: Put (16) from the bank on BBS Whispering Campaign when you rez it. When all the bits have been removed, trash BBS Whispering Campaign. (A): Take (2) from BBS Whispering Campaign.

card.name: Bioweapons Engineering
card.text: Each source of meat damage inflicts +1 meat damage.

card.name: Bizarre Encryption Scheme
card.text: Runner does not score any agenda (or agendas) on a run during which Bizarre Encryption Scheme is accessed, return that agenda to the fort instead. Runner scores the agenda at the start of his or her next turn if neither you nor the Runner has scored it by then. This does not affect any further runs.

card.name: Black Dahlia
card.text: (2): Break sentry subroutine. (2): +2 strength.
card.quote: "She broke my heart - but at least show showed it to me first."

card.name: Black Ice Quality Assurance
card.text: All black ice has +2 strength.

card.name: Blink
card.text: (0): Roll a die. On a 4, 5, or 6, break Ice subroutine; otherwise, suffer that much Net damage. Use this ability only one on each subroutine during each encounter with a piece of Ice.

card.name: Blood Cat
card.text: (A): Trace5 - If trace is successful give Runner a tag.
card.quote: "These break-ins are unacceptable. Put the Cat on him. I want this character tagged so tight we know when he sheds a hair!"

card.name: Boardwalk
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Boardwalk counter. At the start of each of your turns, every 2 Boardwalk counters require the Corp to show you, at random, a card stored in HQ. If the Corp does not have enough cards stored in HQ, the corp shows you as many cards as it has. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Bodyweight Data Creche
card.text: Provides +1 MU. Once per turn, right after making a successful run, you can choose to make another run without taking an action to do so. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
card.quote: "I better hijack another order for a five-gallon saline feed... I might be in here a while."

card.name: Bodyweight Synthetic Blood
card.text: Draw 5 cards.

card.name: Bolter Cluster
card.text: (s) Do 4 Net damage. (s) Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.

card.name: Braindance Campaign
card.text: Put (12) from the bank on Braindance Campaign when you rez it. Take (2) from Braindance Campaign at the start of each of your turns. When all the bits have been removed, trash Braindance Campaign.
card.quote: "So it's a subliminal. What they don't know won't hurt them."

card.name: Broker
card.text: Each of your turns, you may take only one action to use Broker. (A): Put (3) from the bank on Broker. (A): Take all the bits from Broker.

card.name: Butcher Boy
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Butcher Boy counter. Every two Butcher Boy counters you gain (1) at the start of each of your turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Canis Major
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, all further ice is encountered at +2 strength.

card.name: Canis Minor
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, all further ice is encountered at +1 strength.

card.name: Cascade
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Cascade counter. Every two Cascade counters require the Corp to trash faceup one card stored in R&D, at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Cerberus
card.text: (s) Do 3 Net damage. (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a Cerberus counter. Each Cerberus counter does 2 Net damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Cerberus counter by taking an action to spend (4). (s) End the run.

card.name: Chance Observation
card.text: Play only if Runner attempted a run during his or her last turn. Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

card.name: Chester Mix
card.text: Cost to install ice on this fort is reduced by (2).
card.quote: "Of course, he subscribes to the Platonic-solids school of ice-rendering, but he is cheap."

card.name: Chicago Branch
card.text: (A, 3): Add 2 advancement counters to an installed card that can be advanced.

card.name: Chimera
card.text: When a Runner accessed Chimera, trash a daemon.
card.quote: "Watch this. She likes to play with it before she trashes it."

card.name: Cinderella
card.text: (s) Trace6 - If trace is successful, end the run, trash a piece of hardware, and do 2 meat damage. This damage cannot be prevented.

card.name: City Surveillance
card.text: For each card Runner draws, give Runner a tag unless Runner pays (1), in addition to any other costs, to avoid receiving that tag. You may rez City Surveillance just before the card is drawn.

card.name: Cloak
card.text: Put (3) from the bank on Cloak when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
card.quote: "Avoid a netfight if at all possible. You never know when fortune will turn." - Spider Murphy

card.name: Closed Accounts
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Runner loses all bits.
card.quote: "Watch out for the blast shelters First Eurobank builds around its ATMs. They may be great for the rubes, but if some corp has marked your account as illegal, The shelter will seal you in until the cops come." - Kiyote

card.name: Clown
card.text: All ice is encountered with its strength reduced by 1.
card.quote: Dennis "Karl" Duncan transended the need for bits when he developed Hyper Clown AKA "Bozomatic".

card.name: Cockroach
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Cockroach counter. Two or more cockroach counters cause all discards from HQ to become random. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Code Corpse
card.text: (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) End the run.
card.quote: Nothing turns a wannabe into a coulda-been faster then rewriting the forebrain from the inside out.

card.name: Code Viral Cache
card.text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. If the Corp forgoes actions to lose Virus counters, two counters of your choice are not removed. The corp may trash Viral Cache by taking an action to pay (5).

card.name: Codecracker
card.text: (0): Creak code gate subroutine. (1): +1 strength.
card.quote: This product for use by holder of class-A locksmith certification. Propagation of this software and use without proper certification are felony offenses. ("Yeah, right.")

card.name: Codeslinger
card.text: (1): Break sentry subroutine.
card.quote: "There ain't enough bits in this here register fer the both of us, pardner."

card.name: Core Command: Jettison Ice
card.text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Pay the rez cost of a piece of rezzed ice to trash it.

card.name: Corolla Speed Chip
card.text: Put (1) from the bank on Corolla Speed Chip when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using killers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Corporate Ally
card.text: Installing Corporate Ally costs 1 agenda point, in addition to the normal cost. The difficulty of all agendas is +1. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all by one.

card.name: Corporate Boon
card.text: Put four Boon counters on Corporate Boon when you score it. Boon counter: Gain an action. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn.

card.name: Corporate Coup
card.text: Put (15) from the bank on Corporate Coup when you score it. (A): Take (3) from Corporate Coup, if it has any bits.
card.quote: "Here a new style of crime became manifest: death as administrative action." - Horst Kruger

card.name: Corporate Detective Agency
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Trash up to 2 resources, at no cost.

card.name: Corporate Downsizing
card.text: When you score Corporate Downsizing, show to Runner any number of agenda cards stored in HQ. Gain bits equal to twice the combined agenda points of these cards; then shuffle them into R&D.
card.quote: "'Rightsizing.' The word is 'rightsizing.'"

card.name: Corporate Negotiating Center
card.text: At the start of each of your turns, gain (1) for each agenda card stored in HQ that you show to runner.
card.quote: "That which does not get ne fired makes me more valuable to the corporation." - Dave Michaels, Microtech Special Ops

card.name: Corporate Retreat
card.text: You lose the following ability as soon as you rez or install any card. (A): Gain (2).
card.quote: Hard work has a future payoff. Laziness pays off now.

card.name: Corporate War
card.text: If you have (12) or more bits in your pool when you score Corporate War, gain (12); otherwise, lose all bits.
card.quote: The greatest casualty of the early corporate wars was the middle class.

card.name: Corprunner's Shattered Remains
card.text: You may advance Shattered Remains before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Shattered Remains, it destroys one piece of hardware for each advancement counter on it.
card.quote: "It's not that I like screwing you up. It's just that they got me wired so I feel the routines like bugs on my neck, so believe it, brother - I'm gonna swat!"

card.name: Cortical Scanner
card.text: (s) End the run. (s) End the run. (s) End the run.
card.quote: Your brain's the key.

card.name: Cortical Scrub
card.text: (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Sounds nice and hygienic, eh?"

card.name: Cowboy Sysop
card.text: (A): Choose one of your installed cards to be uninstalled. Store it in HQ.

card.name: Crash Everett, Inventive Fixer
card.text: Whenever you draw one or more cards from your stack, draw an extra card; then choose one of the cards drawn and either trash it or return it to the top of your stack. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all by one.

card.name: Crybaby
card.text: When Runner accesses Crybaby, give Runner a Crying counter. Each Crying counter reduces Runners link by 2 during each trace attempt. Runner can remove a Crying counter by taking an action to pay (2).

card.name: Crystal Palace Station Grid
card.text: Runner must pay (1), in addition to the normal cost, to break each subroutine of each piece of ice encountered during runs on this fort. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Crystal Wall
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Yeah, the 'crystal' stuff is about as thick as walls get. But that just means the crunching noise are that much more gratifying when I hammer through it." - Kiyote

card.name: Custodial Position
card.text: Make a run on R&D. If run is successful, access two additional cards from R&D.

card.name: Cyfermaster
card.text: (2): Break code gate subroutine. (1): +1 strength.
card.quote: You can pick a lock; you can pick your friends. Now, thanks to Cyfermaster...

card.name: D'Arc Knight
card.text: (s) Trash a program. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Do your worst, churl! I do not fear your best killers, your fastest evasion programs, your canniest AI routines. All of these I will face and defeat."

card.name: Danshi's Second ID
card.text: (A, T): Remove up to three tags, at no cost.
card.quote: "I'll take the complete package: apartment, ID number, passports, credit account, fake diplomas, fingerprints, retinas..."

card.name: Data Darts
card.text: (s) Do 3 Net damage. (s) Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.

card.name: Data Fort Reclamation
card.text: Gain (10) and choose up to four cards stored in HQ when you score Data Fort Reclamation. Create a new data fort using the cards chosen. Install the cards 1 at a time; you may rez them when you install them. Then, return to the bank any of the (10) not spent.

card.name: Data Masons
card.text: Cost to rez walls is reduced by 2. All walls have +1 strength.
card.quote: "'An eye on top of a pyramid'? No, that's not our Net logo; you must have us confused with another outfit."

card.name: Data Naga
card.text: (s) Trash a program. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "As it says in the Upanishads, O thief: 'You have a right to your labor, but not to the fruits of your labor.'"

card.name: Data Raven
card.text: (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag and a Data Raven counter. Each Data Raven counter gives Runner a tag at the start of each of his or her turns. Runner may remove a Data Raven counter by taking an action to pay (1).

card.name: Data Wall
card.text: (s) End the run.

card.name: Data Wall 2.0
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Can't those chimps in Marketing come up with a different name? This isn't just version 2.0 - it's a complete different program!"

card.name: Databroker
card.text: (A, T, 1 agenda point): Gain (10).
card.quote: "Information does not want to be free; it wants to be liberated and expensive."

card.name: Datapool by Zetatech
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Give Runner two tags.
card.quote: The enemy of your enemy is sometimes also your enemy.

card.name: Day Shift
card.text: Draw two cards and gain (1).
card.quote: "I'm sick of punching the clock. I want to punch my supervisor."

card.name: Deal with Militech
card.text: Play only if you liberated any Research agendas this turn. Put a Militech counter on each of your icebreakers. A Militech counter gives the icebreaker it is on +1 strength.

card.name: Dedicated Response Team
card.text: When Runner accesses Dedicated Response Team, it does 3 meat damage. Ignore this effect unless Runner is tagged.
card.quote: "Excuse me - that's my beeper."

card.name: Deep Thought
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Thought counter. Three or more Thought counters allow you to look at the top card of R&D at the start of each of your turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Department of Truth Enhancement
card.text: (A): Put (3) from the bank on Department of Truth Enhancement. (A): Take all the bits from Department of Truth Enhancement.
card.quote: "We don't lie. We use statistics." - Scott H. Warner, Department Coordinator

card.name: Dermatech Bodyplating
card.text: Prevents 1 meat damage each turn.
card.quote: "Is that the best you can do, corp boy?"

card.name: Desperate Competitor
card.text: Play only if you liberated any Gray Ops agendas this turn. Score 1 agenda point.
card.quote: "We appreciate that you've already promised this property to someone else, and we wouldn't expect you to compromise your honor without proper compensation."

card.name: Detroit Police Contract
card.text: Put (12) from the bank on Detroit Police Contract when you score it. Take (2) from Detroit Police Contract, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns.
card.quote: Corporate security forces are infamous for employing lethal force as a means of reducing overhead.

card.name: Dieter Esslin
card.text: When Runner accesses Dieter Esslin, Dieter does 1 Net damage.
card.quote: "Y'know, sometimes it worries me how much he enjoys his job."

card.name: Diplomatic Immunity
card.text: Prevents all meat damage. The Corp may pay 1 agenda point to cancel this effect until end of turn. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all by one.

card.name: Disinfectant, Inc.
card.text: You may pay (1) to avoid receiving a Virus counter. Use this ability only once each turn.

card.name: Dogcatcher
card.text: (1): Break pit bull, hellhound, bloodhound, or watchdog subroutine. (1): +1 strength.

card.name: Dr. Dreff
card.text: Whenever Runner makes a successful run on this fort, you may choose an ice card stored in HQ. Pay half of that card's rez cost, rounded down, to force the Runner to encounter it. The run is not considered successful unless runner passes that piece of ice. Trash that ice after the encounter ends. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.

card.name: Drifter Mobile Environment
card.text: Put (2) from the bank on Mobile Environment when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for removing tags. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Dropp
card.text: (0): Break ice subroutine. (1): +1 strength. Using Dropp ends your run.

card.name: Dupre
card.text: (1): Break code gate subroutine. (2): +1 strength. Put a +1 strength counter on Dupre after each run during which it was used to break a subroutine. All strength counters on Dupre are lost if you use Dupre on a fort other than the one you last used it on.

card.name: Dwarf
card.text: (1): Break wall subroutine. (1): +1 strength.

card.name: Edgerunner, Inc., Temps
card.text: Gain three consecutive actions, which you may use only to install cards. You are not required to take all three of these actions.
card.quote: "Just remember to sweep the fort for back doors once they're done."

card.name: Edited Shipping Manifests
card.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, and the Corp has any bits when you would access HQ, do not access cards from HQ; instead, the Corp loses (1) and gives you a tag, and you gain (10).
card.quote: "It's another delivery to that warehouse in Chiba for Smith. What does he do with all that product?"

card.name: Efficiency Experts
card.text: Gain (3).
card.quote: Waste not, want not.

card.name: Emergency Self-Construct
card.text: (T): Prevent yourself from being flatlined, though you still lose all cards in your hand. Remove all brain damage. For the remainder of the game, you have only three actions per turn, instead of four; your hand size is reduced by 1; and all meat damage is automatically prevented.

card.name: Employee Empowerment
card.text: You may choose to draw an additional card at the start of each of your turns. (A): Draw 2 cards.
card.quote: "Be glad you don't get all the management the company pays for."

card.name: Encoder, Inc.
card.text: Cost to rez code gates is reduced by (1). All code gates have an additional "(s) End the run." after all other subroutines.

card.name: Encryption Breakthrough
card.text: All code gates have +1 strength. When you score Encryption Breakthrough, reveal as many code gates as you wish. Then, gain (1) for each revealed or rezzed code gate.

card.name: Endless Corridor
card.text: (s) End the run. (s) End the run.
card.quote: The light at the end of the tunnel's been turned off to reduce overhead.

card.name: ESA Contract
card.text: (A): Draw two cards.
card.quote: "You know that orange toothpaste that suppresses your appetite? Yup, that came out of the space program too."

card.name: Euromarket Consortium
card.text: Hand size +2. (A, 1): Draw 2 cards.

card.name: Evil Twin
card.text: (3): Break sentry subroutine. (1): +1 strength. Prevents up to 2 Net and/or brain damage total each turn.
card.quote: "Haven't I seen you somewhere before?"

card.name: Executive Extraction
card.text: Difficulty of Gray Ops agendas is reduced by 1.
card.quote: Sometimes an executive gets tired of waiting for doors to open within her organization, so she asks a rival corp to open the wall for her instead.

card.name: Executive Wiretaps
card.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, access two additional cards from HQ.

card.name: Experimental AI
card.text: You may advance Experimental AI before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Experimental AI, it destroys one program for each advancement counter on it.

card.name: Expert Schedule Analyzer
card.text: After you access cards from HQ, look at all cards stored in HQ.

card.name: Fait Accompli
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on a subsidiary data fort, put a Fait counter in that fort. Every two Fait counters in a fort give +1 difficulty to all agendas installed inside that fort. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Fall Guy
card.text: (T): Avoid receiving a tag.
card.quote: "What I like best about you, Neal, is that you trust me."

card.name: False Echo
card.text: (2): The Corp must rez as much ice as possible on a fort, beginning with the outermost ice and working in. Use this ability only after a successful run on that fort.

card.name: Falsified Transactions Expert
card.text: Move up to three advancement counters from one card to another installed card that can be advanced.

card.name: Fang
card.text: (s) Trace4 - If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay (2).
card.quote: "We provide guide dogs for the morally blind." - Arthur Cohn, JYD Security Enterprises

card.name: Fang 2.0
card.text: (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay (2).

card.name: Fatal Attractor
card.text: (s) The next time Runner encounters a piece of ice during the run, do 3 Net damage unless Runner breaks all subroutines of that piece of ice.

card.name: Fetch 4.0.1
card.text: (s) Trace3 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

card.name: Field Reporter for Ice and Data
card.text: At the end of each of your turns, gain (1) for each piece of ice the Corp rezzed during that turn.

card.name: Filter
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: Friendly even to numerically challenged employees, it accepts transposed numerals in the access codes.

card.name: Fire Wall
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Heat without tissue damage compliments of nerve induction."

card.name: Flak
card.text: (1): Break AP subroutine. (1): +1 strength.

card.name: Floating Runner BBS
card.text: Gain (1) at the beginning of each of your turns.

card.name: Force Shield
card.text: Prevents up to 2 Net and/or brain damage total each turn.
card.quote: "Never use 'em; don't need 'em. My brain's been smoked so much that my myelin's vulcanized. That's why my ears are always dirty." - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: Forged Activation Orders
card.text: Choose a piece of ice. The Corp either rezzes that piece of ice or trashes it.

card.name: Forgotten Backup Chip
card.text: Search your trash for a program and bring it into your hand.
card.quote: "Solo teams are a crap shoot: sometimes they kill you; on the other hand, sometimes you find neat stuff while hiding in your flat."

card.name: Fortress Architects
card.text: Cost to install ice is reduced by 1.
card.quote: "You're working for Saburo Arasaka, not God."

card.name: Fortress Respecification
card.text: Play only if you made a successful run this turn. Rearrange the ice installed on the last fort on which you made a successful run. This does not expose any concealed ice.

card.name: Fragmentation Storm
card.text: (s) Trace4 - If trace is successful, end the run and trash a program, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay (1).

card.name: Full Body Conversion
card.text: Prevents all meat damage. For each (1) the Corp pays when meat damage is done, 1 point of meat damage is not prevented by this card.
card.quote: "Don't use any big words when you talk to him: he's more hardware than wetware."

card.name: Genetics-Visionary Acquisition
card.text: Difficulty of Research agendas is reduced by 1.
card.quote: "The more valuable you are to the corporation, the harder they fight to keep you: witness these casualty figures."

card.name: Gideon's Pawnshop
card.text: Search your trash for a card and bring it into your hand.
card.quote: "The runner stuff's cheap 'cause their next of kin don't know what it's worth any better than the shop owners do."

card.name: Green Knight Surge Buffers
card.text: Prevents 1 Net damage each turn.

card.name: Gremlins
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, give the Corp a Gremlin counter. Every two Gremlin counters decrease the Corp's hand size by 1. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Grubb
card.text: (1): Break wall subroutine. (2): +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
card.quote: "You've got to see it to believe it."

card.name: Hacker Tracker Central
card.text: After each trace attempt, whether successful or not, put (1) from the bank on Hack Tracker Central. During a trace attempt, each bit you spend from Hacker Tracker Central increases by 1 both your trace strength and your trace limit.

card.name: Hammer
card.text: (1): Break wall subroutine. (1): +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Hammer, lose a total of (2) from stealth cards.

card.name: Haunting Inquisition
card.text: (s) Runner cannot make another run during his or her next six actions. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "It's just another nightmare, Johnny. Towel off and go back to sleep."

card.name: Hell's Run
card.text: Put (1) from the bank on Hell's Run when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for increasing your link. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Holovid Campaign
card.text: Put (12) from the bank on Holovid Campaign when you rez it. Take (1) from Holovid Campaign at the start of each of your turns. When all the bits have been removed, trash Holovid Campaign.

card.name: Homewrecker
card.text: (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, end the run, trash a piece of hardware, and do 2 meat damage. This damage cannot be prevented.
card.quote: "It does more than discourage intrusions - it keep our fire department contract in the black."

card.name: Hostile Takeover
card.text: Gain (5) when you score Hostile Takeover.
card.quote: "Tell the Director I'm sorry, but I can't seem to find any reference to 'intact' in the mercenaries' contract."

card.name: Hot Tip for WNS
card.text: Score 1 agenda point if you liberated any Black Ops agendas this turn.
card.quote: "A plot to assassinate Elvis - bizarre but true, and we'll tell you all about it at eleven."

card.name: HQ Interface
card.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access an additional card from HQ.
card.quote: "...from Arasaka to Cuernavaca to Oaxaca - to me the gear does come."

card.name: Hunt Club BBS
card.text: Expose up to three installed cards.
card.quote: "The Hunt Club got it's name from the original programmers, who were self-described 'hunters,' corporate programmers who moonlighted as freelance counter-intrusion agents." - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: Hunter
card.text: (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.

card.name: I Got a Rock
card.text: (A, 3 agenda points): Do 15 meat damage to Runner. Use this ability only if Runner has two or more tags.

card.name: I Spy
card.text: (T): Put a Spy counter in a data fort. A Spy counter exposes all cards installed inside or on a fort containing it. The Corp may remove a Spy counter by taking an action to pay (4). Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that fort.

card.name: Ice and Data's Guide to the Net
card.text: Expose the outermost ice of each data fort.
card.quote: "Meet the ice without hitting the skids." - Advert

card.name: Ice Pick Willie
card.text: (s) Trash a program. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Nice 'breaker you got there. Hate to see anything happen to it."

card.name: Ice Transmutation
card.text: Choose a piece of rezzed ice when you score Ice Transmutation. That ice now has +1 strength, and each subroutine on it is repeated once. Treat this as if each repeated subroutine appeared immediately after the original subroutine.

card.name: If You Want It Done Right
card.text: Look through the top five cards of your stack. Bring one of those cards into your hand, and arrange the rest in any order you choose.
card.quote: "...you gotta do it yourself."

card.name: Imp
card.text: Imp can have up to 2 MU of programs installed in it. All icebreakers installed in this way have their strength reduced by 1. If Imp leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.

card.name: Incubator
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run, give the Corp an Incubate counter. Each Incubate counter necessitates a die roll at the start of each of your turns; on each 6, choose a Virus counter and exchange that counter for two counters of the same type. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Information Laundering
card.text: You may advance Information Laundering before and after you rez it. (A, T): Gain (4) for each advancement counter on Information Laundering.
card.quote: "Information wants to be clean."

card.name: Inside Job
card.text: Make a run. You automatically pass the first piece of ice you encounter during that run.
card.quote: "Preparation beats expiration, if you ask me." - Edger

card.name: Investment Firm
card.text: Take (1) from Investment Firm, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns. Whenever (1) or more bits are added to your pool, you may put (2) from the bank on Investment Firm for each (1) you choose not to add to your pool. Effects that give you bits at the start of your turn cannot be used this way.

card.name: Invisibility
card.text: Put (1) from the bank on Invisibility when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Jack 'n' Joe
card.text: Draw three cards.
card.quote: "There's too much blood in my caffeine system."

card.name: Jack Attack
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, Runner cannot jack out. (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful, give runner a tag.

card.name: Jackhammer
card.text: (0): Break wall subroutine. (1): +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Jackhammer, lose (1) if you can, from a stealth card.

card.name: Japanese Water Torture
card.text: (0): Break wall subroutine. (X): +X strength, and forgo your next X actions.

card.name: Jenny Jett
card.text: Whenever Runner makes a successful run on this fort, you may choose an ice card stored in HQ. Install that piece of ice on this fort in the innermost position, paying an installation cost of (1) for each piece of ice already on the fort. Runner is now considered to be approaching that piece of ice. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.

card.name: Jerusalem City Grid
card.text: Cost to rez walls on this fort is reduced by (2). All walls on this fort have +1 strength. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Joan of Arc
card.text: (T): Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed. (1): Prevent one or more of your other installed programs from being trashed and bring Joan of Arc into your hand.

card.name: Junkyard BBS
card.text: (A, 1): Bring the top card from your trash to your hand.
card.quote: "You wouldn't believe the stuff some people throw away!"

card.name: Karl de Veres, Corporate Stooge
card.text: Gain (1) each time you make a successful run. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all by one.

card.name: Keeper
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: All computers wait at the same speed.

card.name: Kilroy Was Here
card.text: Make a run on R&D; you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in R&D, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
card.quote: "Art is a form of catharsis."

card.name: Krash
card.text: (2): Break ice subroutine. (2): +1 strength.

card.name: Krumz
card.text: Put (1) from the bank on Krumz when you rez it. Use this bit only to pay for traces. If you use this bit, replace it at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Laser Wire
card.text: (s) Do 1 Net damage. (s) End the run.

card.name: Leland, Corporate Bodyguard
card.text: (1): Prevent 1 meat damage. (T): Avoid receiving a tag.
card.quote: "Friends help you move. Real friends help you move bodies."

card.name: Liche
card.text: (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) End the run.

card.name: Lifesaver Nanosurgeons
card.text: (A): Draw two cards. Use this ability only if you were damaged during any of your last three actions. (T): Prevent 1 brain damage.

card.name: Livewire's Contacts
card.text: Gain (3).
card.quote: "Let's get something clear, punk. Out there, you might be a big-shot chiphead with your uptown inputs, but down here you're just another skinny geek from the wrong side of the barricades. So sit down, buy me a Fizz, and let me do all the talking."

card.name: Loan from Chiba
card.text: Gain (12) when Loan from Chiba is installed. At the start of each of your turns, lose (1). If Loan from Chiba leaves play, pay (10) or lose the game. You may trash Loan from Chiba at the end of any of your turns.
card.quote: "I hear their collection agents have organ preserva-paks. And dull scalpels."

card.name: Loony Goon
card.text: (1): Break sentry routine. (1): +1 strength.
card.quote: "Of course you realize... this means war."

card.name: Lucidrine Booster Drug
card.text: Make a run, and gain (9), which you may use only during that run. After that run is completed, suffer 1 brain damage; this damage cannot be prevented. Then return to the bank any of the (9) not spent.

card.name: Main-Office Relocation
card.text: Hand size +2.
card.quote: Corporate relocation efforts have become a much riskier proposition since the advert of the corporate war. Often, a corp's security teams will have to arrange armored convoys to prevent thefts.

card.name: Management Shake-Up
card.text: Add three advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
card.quote: Don't be irreplaceable. If you can't be replaced, you can't be promoted.

card.name: Mantis, Fixer-at-Large
card.text: Search your stack for a card and bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.
card.quote: "Yeah, I can get it for you, and if you want me to break a few fingers, I'll throw that in for free."

card.name: Marine Arcology
card.text: (A, A): Gain (3).
card.quote: "We could have accepted that bid, but in Nipponese wet real estate there're ultimately two kinds of construction: tsunami spec... and bait bucket."

card.name: Mastiff
card.text: (s) Do 1 brain damage. (s) Do 1 Net damage. (s) For the remainder of the run, all ice is encountered at +1 strength. (s) Trace5 - If trace is successful give Runner a Mastiff counter. Each Mastiff counter does 1 brain damage at the start of each run. Runner may remove a Mastiff counter by taking an action to spend (4). (s) End the run.

card.name: Mazer
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Some Greek software house makes a variant that includes a killer with a minotaur motif. If you take too long to get through, it sics the minotaur on you, instead of cutting your connection. Lame cliches never die, I guess." - Spider Murphy

card.name: Microtech 'Trode Set
card.text: Pay (1), in addition to the normal cost, to break each ice subroutine. Ignore all AP subroutines except those that trace or do Net damage. Prevents all but 1 Net damage from AP subroutines you do not break.

card.name: Microtech AI Interface
card.text: Whenever you are about to access cards from R&D, you may first choose to cut any number of cards from the top of R&D to the bottom of R&D.

card.name: Microtech Backup Drive
card.text: Whenever one or more installed programs are being sent to the trash at the same time, you may instead choose to put any or all of the programs on top of Microtech Backup Drive in any order you choose. If Backup Drive is removed from play, trash any cards on it. (A): Bring the top card on Backup Drive into your hand.

card.name: Militech MRAM Chip
card.text: Hand size +3.
card.quote: "I have a hard time remembering, when the chips are down."

card.name: misc.for-sale
card.text: Trash any number of your installed cards. Gain (3) for each card trashed in this way.
card.quote: "Why throw it away when you can convince some half-brained weef to use it for creative suicide instead?" - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: MIT West Tier
card.text: Shuffle your hand, trash, and stack together, and then draw five cards. When you play MIT West Tier, remove it from the game instead of trashing it.

card.name: Mouse
card.text: (A): Expose a card installed inside a data fort.
card.quote: "If a man... make a better mousetrap than his neighbour, tho' he build his house in the woods, the world will make a beaten path to his door." - Ralph Waldo Emerson, quoted by Sarah S.B. Yule, Borrowings

card.name: MRAM Chip
card.text: Hand size +2.
card.quote: "Your brain's just like any other appliance, chummer. Works better if you plug it in." - Joey Two-Tails

card.name: Mystery Box
card.text: (0): Show the top five cards of your stack to the Corp. If any of those cards are programs, trash Mystery Box and then install one of those programs, at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run and only once each run.

card.name: N.E.T.O.
card.text: (A): Look at the top four cards of your stack. You may bring any prep or resource card among them into your hand. Pay (1) for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack.

card.name: Namatoki Plaza
card.text: Rez Namatoki Plaza when you install it. Install Namatoki Plaza only if you can pay to rez it. Install only inside a subsidiary data fort. That fort may have an additional agenda or node installed inside it. If Namatoki Plaza leaves play while installed, and this results in the fort having too many agendas and nodes installed inside it, trash one of those agendas or nodes.

card.name: Nasuko Cycle
card.text: (3): Avoid receiving a tag.
card.quote: Puts the world into fast forward so you can skip scenes that ain't so pretty.

card.name: Nerve Labyrinth
card.text: (s) Do 2 Net damage. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "But it's a great training ground for navigating wilderspace." - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: Netspace Inverter
card.text: Reverse a fort's ice cards so that the outermost piece of ice becomes the innermost piece of ice, and so forth. Use this ability only immediately after a successful run on that data fort.

card.name: Netwatch Credit Voucher
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Give runner a tag, and gain (1).

card.name: Netwatch Operations Office
card.text: (A): Trace2 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
card.quote: "These Netwatch goons are okay, but I'm thinking we should have started own police program instead."

card.name: Neural Blade
card.text: (s) Do 1 net damage. (s) Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run.

card.name: Nevinyrral
card.text: Gain an action during each of your turns. If Nevinyrral leaves play while rezzed, you lose the game. Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all by one.

card.name: New Blood
card.text: Conceal all revealed but unrezzed ice; then rearrange your installed ice by swapping pairs of ice while Runner looks away.
card.quote: "I hate newbie sysops. They always rearrange our ice into some weird configuration just because it matches some stupid question on their finals."

card.name: New Galveston City Grid
card.text: All nodes and other upgrades installed inside this fort cost (2) to trash, in addition to the normal cost. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Newsgroup Filter
card.text: (A): Gain (2).
card.quote: You can find some useful stuff in the newsgroups if you can enlist an AI with the patience to wade through all the garbage.

card.name: Newsgroup Taunting
card.text: At the start of each run, Runner must pay (1), in addition to any other costs, or end the run.

card.name: Night Shift
card.text: Gain (2) and draw one card.
card.quote: "It wasn't until my certification boards that it began to dawn on me that nights aren't infinitely long."

card.name: Nomad Allies
card.text: (A, 1): Remove a tag at no cost. (T): Avoid receiving a tag.
card.quote: "So, what are we calling you this month?"

card.name: Off-Site Backups
card.text: Bring any card from the Archives into HQ.
card.quote: Data saved is eurobucks earned.

card.name: Olivia Salazar
card.text: For half cost, rounded down, rez a piece of ice installed on this fort. Derez that ice at the end of the turn. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.

card.name: Omni Kismet, Ph.D
card.text: Swap a piece of unrezzed ice on this fort with an ice card stored in HQ. The new ice card comes into play concealed. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort.
card.quote: "What the...?! That wasn't in the plans!" - Epitaph

card.name: Omniscience Foundation
card.text: Give runner a tag at the end of each turn during which runner received a tag.

card.name: On-Call Solo Team
card.text: (A): Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
card.quote: "Corporate solo teams operate much like government death squads, with the primary difference being that solo teams aren't clumsy enough to let themselves be exposed."

card.name: Open-Ended Mileage Program
card.text: Remove a tag, at no cost. You may pay (1) when you play Open-Ended Mileage Program to take it back into your hand instead of trashing it.

card.name: Organ Donor
card.text: Trash up to five cards from your hand. Gain (2) for each card trashed in this way.
card.quote: "I really need the scratch, and well, I do have two of them..."

card.name: Overtime Incentives
card.text: Gain two actions.
card.quote: "Hey, the door is stuck."

card.name: Pacifica Regional AI
card.text: You may advance Pacifica Regional AI before and after you rez it. Regional AI advancement counter: Gain an action.

card.name: Pandora's Deck
card.text: Provides +2 MU. Put (3) from the bank when Pandora's Deck when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Paris City Grid
card.text: Put (3) from the bank on Paris City Grid when you rez it. Use these bits only to pay for traces made during runs on this fort. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Parraline 5750
card.text: Provides +1 MU. Put (1) from the bank on Parraline 5750 when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Pattel's Virus
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pattel counter on a piece of ice that had all its subroutines broken during that run. Each Pattel counter on a piece of ice reduces its strength by 1. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Pi in the 'Face
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Nyuk, nyuk, nyuk..."

card.name: Pile Driver
card.text: (3): Break up to four wall subroutines on a single piece of ice. (1): +1 strength. Whenever you use Pile Driver's break-walls subroutine, lose a total of (3) from stealth cards.

card.name: PK-6089a
card.text: Provides +1 MU. Put (3) from the bank on PK-6089a when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.
card.quote: "Hey, this sucker can keep your deadline from becoming a flatline." - Dog

card.name: Planning Consultants
card.text: Look at the top five cards of R&D and arrange them in any order you choose.
card.quote: "Chance favors the prepared mind." - Sire Isaac Newton

card.name: Playful AI
card.text: Roll a die. On a 1, 2, or 3, gain that many bits, set aside that many dice to roll again, or choose some combination thereof. Repeat until you have rolled all the dice you set aside.
card.quote: "Gaming is a mode of transferring property without producing any intermediate good." - Samuel Johnson

card.name: Pocket Virtual Reality
card.text: (s) Trace6 - If trace is successful, give runner a tag. (s) Trace6 - If trace is successful, give runner a tag. Whenever Pocket Virtual Reality is encountered, gain (4). Use these bits only to pay for the above traces. When the encounter ends, return to the bank any of the (4) you did not spend.

card.name: Political Coup
card.text: Put (12) from the bank on Political Coup when you score it. (A): Take (3) from Political Coup, if it has any bits.
card.quote: "Assassination is the extreme form of censorship." - George Bernard Shaw, The Rejected Statement

card.name: Political Overthrow
card.text: (A): Gain (3).
card.quote: "You know, these small island countries are becoming less and less of a challenge."

card.name: Poltergeist
card.text: Put (2) on Poltergeist when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing nodes. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Polymer Breakthrough
card.text: Gain (1) at the start of each of your turns.

card.name: Power Grid Overload
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Trash X pieces of hardware, other than cybernetics.

card.name: Pox
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run, put a Pox counter in the fort that was run. Every two Pox counters in a fort require the Corp to pay (1), in addition to any other costs, to install a card inside or on that fort. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Preying Mantis
card.text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action. If you do, suffer 1 brain damage at the end of the turn. This damage cannot be prevented.
card.quote: "First hit's free!"

card.name: Priority Requisition
card.text: You may rez a piece of ice, at no cost, when you score Priority Requisition.
card.quote: "I just gave the big guy a rundown of last month's security breaches, and bingo! we've got a new budget."

card.name: Priority Wreck
card.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, pay any number of bits to force Corp to lose that many bits.
card.quote: "Your personal icon is unrecognized, Chairman; I cannot process this file. Please input authorization code within - Thank you. Filename 'Suckers!' overwrite of HQ datacore commencing as requested!"

card.name: Private Cybernet Police
card.text: (A): Trace5 - If trace is successful, give Runner a tag.
card.quote: "Seen a pink panda about yay high come through this BBS lately? No? Well, here's my hypercard anyway; if you notice anything unusual, just drop me a line."

card.name: Private LDL Access
card.text: Make a run on HQ. If run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, treat run as a successful run on R&D.

card.name: Project Babylon
card.text: Score 1 additional agenda point for every two advancement counters over Project Babylon's difficulty that are on Project Babylon when you score it.

card.name: Project Consultants
card.text: Add 4 advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.

card.name: Punitive Counterstrike
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 2 meat damage.
card.quote: "Violence isn't always the best approached but it's often the most direct." - Anonymous WuTech VP

card.name: Quandary
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "So many decisions, so little ti-"

card.name: Quest for Cattekin
card.text: At the start of each of your turns, roll a die. On a 6, trash Quest for Cattekin, and you gain an action on each of your turns for the remainder of the game. On a 1, suffer 1 brain damage. On a 2, suffer 1 Net damage. Damage from Quest for Cattekin cannot be prevented.

card.name: Rabbit
card.text: Ice that attempts to trace you has its trace limit reduced by 1.

card.name: Raffles
card.text: (1): Break code gate subroutine. (2): +1 strength.

card.name: Ramming Piston
card.text: (2): Break wall subroutine. (1): +1 strength. Whenever you break a wall subroutine with Ramming Piston, lose a total of (2) from stealth cards.

card.name: Raptor
card.text: (2): Break sentry subroutine. (1): +1 strength.
card.quote: "There's nothing quite like the screech of a Raptor echoing through the data halls as it sweeps in for a kill."

card.name: Raven Microcyb Eagle
card.text: Provides +1 MU. Prevents 1 Net damage each turn. Put (1) from the bank on Microcyb Eagle when it is installed. Use this bit only to pay for using icebreakers during runs. If you use the bit, replace it at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Raven Microcyb Owl
card.text: Provides +1 MU. Put (3) from the bank on Microcyb Owl when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Razor Wire
card.text: (s) Do 2 Net damage. (s) End the run.

card.name: Record Reconstructor
card.text: Make a run on the Archives. If run is successful, do not access cards from the Archives; instead, shuffle the face-up pile of the Archives and then put the top two cards from that pile on R&D.

card.name: Red Herrings
card.text: Runner must pay (5), in addition to any other costs, to steal agendas accessed from this fort, even on the run during which Runner trashes Red Herrings.
card.quote: "Frack! It's easier to find things on my floor than in this mess."

card.name: Reflector
card.text: (0): Break stun, hellbolt, or knockout subroutine.
card.quote: "This icebreaker is basically a last-ditch defense for when your Killers aren't getting the job done. It takes advantage of a design flaw in these sorts of ice to reflect their unique signals back at them, crashing their detection routines." - Digital Dana

card.name: Reinforced Wall
card.text: (s) End the run. (s) End the run.

card.name: Remote Facility
card.text: Gain an action during each of your turns.
card.quote: "While moving corporate operations to a remote location increases processing costs, it becomes easier to defend vital information against attempts at hostile acquisition." - David Samms, corporate consultant

card.name: Replicator
card.text: (0): Break ice subroutine that traces. (1): +1 strength.

card.name: Rescheduler
card.text: (A): Note the number of cards stored in HQ. Shuffle those cards into R&D, and then draw that many cards.

card.name: Restrictive Net Zoning
card.text: Choose a data fort when Restrictive Net Zoning is installed. The Corp must pay (2), in addition to the normal cost, to install ice on that fort.
card.quote: Corporation wishing to conduct business here should consider the cost of getting intrusion countermeasures to blend with the high-rez scenery of an AW-1 (Alice in Wonderland) Zone.

card.name: Rex
card.text: (s) Trace3 - If trace is successful, end the run, and Runner cannot run again until Runner takes an action to pay (2).

card.name: Rigged Investments
card.text: Put (12) from the bank on Rigged Investments when it is installed. At the start of each of your turns, take (1) from Rigged Investments. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rigged Investments.

card.name: Rio de Janeiro City Grid
card.text: Roll a die whenever Runner passes a piece of rezzed ice during a run on this fort. On a 1, end the run. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.
card.quote: "There's a new jungle in Brazil - the rusted-wire maze of telecom retrotech. Prepare to have your line dropped, and..."

card.name: Rock Is Strong
card.text: (s) End the run.
card.quote: "I hear we have to watch out for a new icebreaker called 'Paper is True.'"

card.name: Rockerboy Promotion
card.text: Put (15) from the bank on Rockerboy Promotion when you rez it. When all the bits have been removed, trash Rockerboy Promotion. (A): Take (3) from Rockerboy Promotion.

card.name: Romp through HQ
card.text: Make a run on HQ; you may trash, at no cost, any cards you access that were stored in HQ, even if the cards cannot normally be trashed.
card.quote: "I love the sound of screaming crystal. Sadly, I seem to be the one to hear it." - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: Ronin Around
card.text: (A): Look at the top five cards of your stack. You may bring any hardware cards among them into your hand. Pay (1) for each card taken in this way, and show those cards to the Corp. Shuffle the rest back into your stack. (A, 2): Expose any card.

card.name: Roving Submarine
card.text: Install only inside a subsidiary data fort. This fort may be run only if you installed or advanced a card inside or on this fort during your last turn. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Rustbelt HQ Branch
card.text: Hand size +2.
card.quote: "'Systems are heavily monitored, and computer crime treated with draconian ferocity.' Sounds like Heaven."

card.name: Scatter Shot
card.text: Put (2) from the bank on Scatter Shot when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for trashing upgrades. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.

card.name: Schlaghund
card.text: (A): Roll a die. If you roll less than or equal to the number of tags the runner has, Schlaghund does 10 meat damage and you trash Schlaghund.
card.quote: "Remember when your mother told you not to pet strange dogs? That's advice to live by."

card.name: Scorched Earth
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 4 meat damage.

card.name: Score!
card.text: Gain (9).
card.quote: "If someone has consistently good luck, it ain't luck." - Spider Murphy

card.name: Scramble
card.text: (s) End the run.

card.name: Security Code WORM Chip
card.text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Trash a piece of unrezzed ice.

card.name: Security Net Optimization
card.text: Choose a fort when you score Security Net Optimization. That fort gives all ice installed on it +1 strength.
card.quote: "Obsolete? Upgrade it... yesterday."

card.name: Security Purge
card.text: Show the top three cards of R&D to Runner when you score Security Purge. If any of those cards are ice, install and rez them, at no cost. Trash the rest of those cards.

card.name: SeeYa
card.text: (A, 1): Expose an installed card.
card.quote: "It's like a pair of magic specs." - Urza Bloodrunner

card.name: Self-Modifying Code
card.text: (T): Search your stack for a program and install that program if you can. Shuffle your stack afterwards. Use this ability only during a run.
card.quote: "Now, if I could just do this with my DNA... on the fly... while eating." - Rache Bartmoss

card.name: Sentinels Prime
card.text: (s) Trash a program. (s) End the run.

card.name: Shaka
card.text: (1): Break sentry subroutine. (2): +1 strength.

card.name: Shield
card.text: Prevents up to 2 Net damage each turn.
card.quote: Practice safe hacks: use Spartan(r) shields.

card.name: Shock.r
card.text: (s) Runner cannot break any subroutines of the next piece of ice encountered during the run and cannot jack out until after that encounter.

card.name: Short-Term Contract
card.text: Put (12) from the bank on Short-Term Contract when it is installed. When all the bits have been removed, trash Short-Term Contract. (A): Take (2) from Short-Term Contract.
card.quote: "Contrary to popular opinion, we are productive members of society. We just moonlight as data raiders." - Spider Murphy

card.name: Shotgun Wire
card.text: (s) Do 2 Net damage. (s) End the run.

card.name: Shredder Uplink Protocol
card.text: (A): Make a run on the Archives. If the run is successful, do not access cards from the archives; instead, treat run as a successful run on HQ.
card.quote: "Gives a whole new meaning to the term 'trashing.'"

card.name: Signpost
card.text: (1): +2 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.

card.name: Silicon Saloon Franchise
card.text: (A): Gain (1) and draw one card.
card.quote: WANTED: Enterprising civilian with capital to invest in entertainment franchise. Management experience not required. Corporations, nomads, and AIs need not apply.

card.name: Silver Lining Recovery Protocol
card.text: If any agendas were stolen during Runner's last turn, gain bits equal to three times the number of advancement counters those agendas had.

card.name: Singapore City Grid
card.text: Swap a piece of unrezzed ice on this fort with an ice card stored in HQ. The new ice card comes into play concealed. Use this ability only once during each run on this fort. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Skalderviken SA Beta Test Site
card.text: Cost to rez black ice is reduced by 2.
card.quote: "When you rez this, it's very important that you have its administrator be there for it to imprint on him."

card.name: Skivviss
card.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, give the Corp a Skivviss counter. Each Skivviss Counter requires the Corp to draw one extra card at the start of each of its turns. The Corp may remove all Virus counters at any time, but must then forgo its next three actions.

card.name: Sleeper
card.text: (s) End the run.

card.name: Smarteye
card.text: Once during each run, you may expose a piece of unrezzed ice as you approach it. You may then jack out before the Corp decides whether to rez the ice.

card.name: Smith's Pawnshop
card.text: At the start of each of your turns, you may trash one of your other installed cards to gain (2). Only one unique card of a particular name can be in play at a time. If for some reason more than one is in play, trash all by one.

card.name: Sneak Preview
card.text: Choose a program from your trash or search your stack for a program. Install that program at no cost. Shuffle your stack afterwards. At the end of the turn take the program into your hand.

card.name: Snowball
card.text: Snowball has +1 strength for each subroutine it has broken during a run, until the end of that run. (1): Break sentry subroutine. (1): +1 strength.

card.name: Social Engineering
card.text: Hide at least 2 from your pool in your hand; the Corp then guesses how many bits you hid. If the Corp guesses correctly, lose that many bits. Otherwise, choose a data fort and a piece of ICE on that fort. Then make a run on that fort, during which you automatically pass that piece of ICE.

card.name: Solo Squad
card.text: (A): Do 1 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.

card.name: South African Mining Corp
card.text: (A, A, A): Gain (6).

card.name: Speed Trap
card.text: (0): Jack out before an upgrade or node takes effect. Use this ability only immediately after the Corp has rezzed that upgrade or node.
card.quote: This program is solely intended for emergency extrication from hazards presented during inadvertent trespass; it in no way is intended to encourage willful trespass or other illegal action. ("Yeah, right.")

card.name: Spinn Public Relations
card.text: Take (1) from Spinn Public Relations, if it has any bits, at the start of each of your turns. (A): Put (3) from then bank on Spinn Public Relations.
card.quote: "Of course it's true! I saw it on the 'vid."

card.name: Startup Immolator
card.text: (T): Pay the rez cost of a piece of ice to trash that piece of ice. Use this ability only if you have just broken all the subroutines of that piece of ice.

card.name: Strike Force Kali
card.text: (A): Do 2 meat damage. Use this ability only if Runner is tagged.
card.quote: "What's it mean? Kali's a hellacious goddess of destruction with multiple hands - you figure it out."

card.name: Stumble through Wilderspace
card.text: Make a run. You have +9 link for every trace attempt made during that run.
card.quote: "So I guess what Wilderspace really is to me is the Net in the raw." - Edger, "Wilderspace is Nothing"

card.name: Submarine Uplink
card.text: (0): Base link 4. (1): +1 link. You may use Submarine Uplink only during a run. Using Submarine Uplink forces you to jack out after the current encounter ends. Use only one base link card for each trace attempt made against you.

card.name: Subsidiary Branch
card.text: Gain an action during each of your turns.
card.quote: "It's an off-site location for our creative talent; we call it 'the bomb shelter from bureaucracy.'"

card.name: Succubus
card.text: Succubus can have up to 3 MU of programs installed in it. If Succubus leaves play, trash all programs installed in it.
card.quote: "Hey, server..."

card.name: Superior Net Barriers
card.text: All walls have +1 strength. When you score Superior Net Barriers, reveal as many walls as you wish, then gain (1) for each revealed or rezzed wall.

card.name: Synchronized Attack on HQ
card.text: Play only if you make a successful run on HQ this turn. The Corp discards all cards. The Corp can retain cards by paying (2) for each card not discarded.
card.quote: "You just take out the guards. Let me worry about the doors and elevators."

card.name: Systematic Layoffs
card.text: Add two advancement counters to any combination of installed cards that can be advanced.
card.quote: "Yes, but what have you done for us this week?"

card.name: Team Restructuring
card.text: Add one advancement counter to each of up to two installed cards that can be advanced.
card.quote: Executive ability is deciding quickly and getting somebody else to do the work.

card.name: Technician Lover
card.text: (A): Look at the top card of R&D.
card.quote: "Enough about me. How's work?"

card.name: Techtronica Utility Suit
card.text: Provides +1 MU. Prevents 1 meat damage each turn. Put (5) on Techtronica Utility Suit when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for increasing your link. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn. Only one deck can be in play at a time. Trash any older decks.

card.name: Temple Microcode Outlet
card.text: Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp, and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.

card.name: Terrorist Reprisal
card.text: Play only if the Corp scored any Black Ops agendas during its last turn. The Corp discards five cards at random.
card.quote: "I said, 'No problem. Which half of your daughter do you want back?"

card.name: Tesseract Fort Construction
card.text: All ice on this fort has an additional subroutine, "(s) End the run unless Runner pays (1)," after all other subroutines.
card.quote: "Depends on how you look at it."

card.name: The Shell Traders
card.text: (A): Choose a program or hardware card from your hand. Set that card aside, and put a number of shell counters on it equal to its installation cost. When the last shell counter on that card has been removed, install that card, at no cost. Remove one shell counter from one card at the start of each of your turns. (1): Remove one shell counter from a card.

card.name: The Short Circuit
card.text: (A, 1): Search your stack for a program. Show that program to the Corp and then bring it into your hand. Reshuffle your stack afterwards.

card.name: The Springboard
card.text: (1): +1 link. Use this ability only once during each trace attempt, and only after you and the Corp have revealed how much each of you spent.
card.quote: "Blow 600 eb or risk blowing your cortex - it's your choice." - Springboard advertisement

card.name: Tinweasel
card.text: (0): Break code gate subroutine.
card.quote: "Why, yes, I do speak fluent Navajo."

card.name: TKO 2.0
card.text: (s) End the run, and Runner forgoes his or her next action.
card.quote: "There's nothing like a right hook to the left side of your brain to throw you a loop." - Digital Dana

card.name: Tokyo-Chiba Infighting
card.text: Gain (2) after each unsuccessful run on this fort. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Too Many Doors
card.text: (s) Secretly spend (0), (1), or (2); Runner does the same. Then you and Runner reveal how much each of you spent. End the run unless you spent as many bits ar Runner spent.

card.name: Top Runners Conference
card.text: Gain (2) at the beginning of each of your turns. Trash Top Runners Conference when you make a run.
card.quote: "I have discovered a truly elegant codebreaking routine. Unfortunately, this chip is not large enough to contain it."

card.name: Total Genetic Retrofit
card.text: Remove all tags, at no cost, and automatically avoid receiving your next tag.
card.quote: "Twenty years ago it would have been just a new set of fingerprints."

card.name: Trauma Team
card.text: Put two Trauma counters on Trauma Team when it is installed. Trauma counter: Prevent 1 meat damage. (A): Put one Trauma counter on Trauma Team.

card.name: Triggerman
card.text: (s) Trash a program. (s) End the run.
card.quote: "Sweetheart, the emotional processing of two lonely ROM constructs isn't allocated a megabyte of RAM in this crazy world."

card.name: Trojan Horse
card.text: Play only if Runner stole any agendas during his or her last turn. Give runner a tag.
card.quote: The high-tech equivalent of a teller slipping a paint bomb into a money bag.

card.name: Turbeau Delacroix
card.text: Trace10 - If trace is successful, give runner a tag. Use this ability only when runner accesses Turbeau Delacroix and only once during each run on this fort.

card.name: Tutor
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, all ice encountered has an additional subroutine, "(s) End the run," after all other subroutines.

card.name: Twenty-Four-Hour Surveillance
card.text: During runs on this fort, Runner cannot use bits from stealth sources.

card.name: Tycho Extension
card.quote: "Of course I fired him for playing games on duty! We can't have our sysops idling on the job. Remember the last time a corporation tried to extend the colony? A runner edited the blueprints, and the airlock system failed. Some asteroid miners spotted the bodies floating by 'bout a month ago."

card.name: Tycho Mem Chip
card.text: Provides +3 MU.
card.quote: "What's a megabyte?"

card.name: Umbrella Policy
card.text: (T): Prevent an installed program or hardware card from being trashed.
card.quote: "I cashed in their warranty when my utility was trashed by their own ice!" - Spider Murphy

card.name: Urban Renewal
card.text: Play only if Runner is tagged. Do 5 meat damage.
card.quote: "The paper work has been clearly posted in the basement closet of City Hall since last Thursday."

card.name: Vacant Soulkiller
card.text: You may advance Vacant Soulkiller before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Vacant Soulkiller, it does 1 brain damage for each advancement counter on it.
card.quote: The original Soulkiller started as a matrix to contain artificial personalities, but Arasaka forced the original engineer to enhance the design for its own purpose.

card.name: Vacuum Link
card.text: (s) Roll a die. If you roll a 1, 2, or 3 Runner resumes the run from that many pieces of rezzed ice back, or jacks out. If there are not that many pieces of ice, runner returns to the first piece of ice.

card.name: Valu-Pak Software Bundle
card.text: Gain up to five consecutive actions, which you may use only to install programs, and gain (1). If you do not spend the bit during these actions, return it to the bank afterwards.

card.name: Vapor Ops
card.text: You may advance Vapor Ops before and after you rez it. Vapor Ops advancement counter: Gain (1). (A): Move any number of advancement counters from Vapor Ops to another installed card that can be advanced.

card.name: Vewy Vewy Quiet
card.text: Put (2) from the bank on Vewy Vewy Quiet when it is installed. Use these bits only to pay for using icebreakers during runs, but not for using noisy icebreakers. If you use any of these bits, replace them at the start of your next turn.
card.quote: "You know what I like? Sneaking all the way in, and then barking all the way out!" - Dog

card.name: Viral 15
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay (1) to jack out, in addition to any other costs. (s) For the remainder of the run, Runner trashes an installed program after passing each piece of rezzed ice, including Viral 15, unless runner jacks out.

card.name: Virizz
card.text: (s) For the remainder of the run, Runner must pay an additional (1) to break each ice subroutine.

card.name: Virus Test Site
card.text: You may advance Virus Test Site before and after you rez it. When Runner accesses Test Site, it does 2 Net damage per advancement counter on it, or 1 Net damage if it has no counters, even if it is not installed or rezzed. Ignore this effect if Runner accesses it from the Archives. If Test Site is accessed from R&D, Runner must show it to you.

card.name: Wall of Ice
card.text: (s) Do 2 Net damage. (s) Do 2 Net damage. (s) End the run. (s) End the run.

card.name: Wall of Static
card.text: (s) End the run.

card.name: Washington, D.C., City Grid
card.text: The difficulty of agendas installed inside this fort is reduced by 1. Rez a region when you install it. Install a region only if you can pay to rez it. Only one region may be installed in each data fort. Trash older ones.

card.name: Weather-to-Finance Pipe
card.text: Make a run on HQ. If the run is successful, do not access cards from HQ; instead, the Corp loses (4).
card.quote: Fractal weather system modeling is best routed to Accounts Receivable if you wanted to caused a stir; a route to Market Research is likely to go unnoticed.

card.name: Wild Card
card.text: (0): Break sentry subroutine. (3): +1 strength.
card.quote: The survival of Al Capone's cronies into cyberspace has almost spiritual significance to many runners.

card.name: Wilson, Weeflerunner Apprentice
card.text: Each of your turns, you may choose to gain an action, which you may use only to make a run. You cannot spend more than (3) during that run to pay for using icebreakers or increasing your link. Use this ability only once per turn and only during your turn. (T): Avoid receiving a tag. (T): Prevent any amount of meat damage.

card.name: Wizard's Book
card.text: (0): Break code gate subroutine. (2): +1 strength.
card.quote: Voluntas vincit omnia.

card.name: Worm
card.text: (0): Break wall subroutine. (3): +1 strength.
card.quote: "It's hard to describe - but don't eat anything just before you watch it go into action."

card.name: WuTech Mem Chip
card.text: Provides +1 MU.
card.quote: "Here at WuTech, we take pride in our quest to make memory cheaper than water." - Erin Devlin, WuTech COO

card.name: Zetatech Mem Chip
card.text: Provides +2 MU.
card.quote: In 2019, sales dipped because of a rumor that the odd chip contained a miniature transmitter that sent the chip's data, encrypted, to the nearest Zetatech facility.

card.name: Zetatech Software Installer
